{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3283981,"name":"Wilson Chen","username":"D0LPH1N","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/d0lph1n/{size}/210046_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-14T05:28:06.805Z","cooked":"

Hello!

On behalf of Team 5924, I would like to share this FRC CRESCENDO Trajectory Calculator that I created on Desmos 3D. There are a total of seven variables that you can manipulate. They are as follows:

  1. Initial Velocity
  2. Launch Angle
  3. Launch Height
  4. Launcher X position
  5. Launcher Y position
  6. Predicted Trajectory/Path of NOTE
  7. Orientation (rotation) of SPEAKER and SUBWOOFER

As of now, there may be some inaccuracies regarding the launcher starting position. I will try to resolve these issues in the near future – this is just a proof of concept. Any suggestions/improvements are welcome!

Desmos

FRC CRESCENDO Trajectory Calculator

Explore math with our beautiful, free online graphing calculator. Graph functions, plot points, visualize algebraic equations, add sliders, animate graphs, and more.

– Wilson Chen, Team 5924

You may find something useful in our calculator as well as the one derived by 1757’s students:

Team 177 | Bobcat Robotics | 2024 Build Blog FRC Open Alliance
Shooter Trajectory Calculation Team Resource Welcome back! Our team is in the midst of making some final strategy based robot architecture requirements which will then trickle down into mechanism requirements. These requirements get more granular and more specific the further you go down…but that’s a topic for another post. During many discussions, we need to determine what kinds of shots on goals, such as the Speaker in 2024, are feasible based on a multivariate approach. This can include thin…
FRC 1757 Wolverines 2023-2024 Build Thread FRC Open Alliance
Micro-resource! Hey all, As we’re looking at what ranges / speeds to target for in our mechanisms, we combined 177’s perfect trajectory calculator with a resource from 22 for cargo shot calculator ( unfortunately couldn’t find where it originally came from ) and presenting: The desmos perfect shot calculator! Feel free to play around with it, drag around the launch position, tweak your own speed/velocity values instead of using the auto-calculated ones. Hope this helps teams out! …

Hello. As of now, Position_X = 0 is not related to distance away from the speaker. However, I am working on the issue of fixing an initial position at the moment. I will try to finish by the end of this week :).

Update:

I’ve finally had the time to make some changes to the trajectory calculator/simulator. There are two big changes.

First change:

I’ve added a green dot to the graph, which marks the location of the shooter. Position_X, Position_Y, and height are in relation to the origin of the graph!

Second change:

With some inspiration from other Desmos trajectory graphs which account for possible error (such as this one and this one from 2022), I’ve also included two sliders which you can play around with to introduce possible margins of error to the initial launch angle and launch velocity!

Screenshot 2024-01-17 at 11.56.41 PM898×552 23.7 KB

Thank you all so much for all the helpful comments and feedback. I’ve linked the new and improved Desmos trajectory calculator below :). Any further comments/suggestions are always welcome!

Desmos

FRC CRESCENDO Trajectory Calculator

Explore math with our beautiful, free online graphing calculator. Graph functions, plot points, visualize algebraic equations, add sliders, animate graphs, and more.
